Reviews.Title: “Average I Guess”
Reviews.Author: badman525
Reviews.Content: First trip to Mexico City area. Clean and courteous. Felt safe at all times. You could play quarters on the beds. Hard as a table top. It may be the price you pay for safety but I may have to seek therapy to find relief. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Walmart was within walking distance in case you forgot your shaving cream, tequila or motorcycle. A little different than the states. All part of the charm. The bar was nothing to get excited about. Very little selection. Over all it was just average for the accommodation but exceptional on location and safety.

Reviews.Title: “Primarily Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marsa18
Reviews.Content: Pricey but primarily a business hotel. Pool was unusable. The staff at the Fiesta Inn was relatively friendly. However, communication between hotel and taxi service needed improvement. Even though I had made arrangements to be picked up at the airport, this did not occur. Wifi access was good throughout hotel. You might consider walking to other restaurants near this hotel for other food options. Visited this hotel on a business trip to the Ford Assembly Plant on Sept.of 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Good but no value for money...”
Reviews.Author: satyendra79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Fiesta Inn Cuautitlan for 5 nights, the location of hotel is quite good, walmart, Starbucks, cinemex and many other shops are nearby. Rooms are small and breakfast was not included in charges even after paying USD $121 per day. It was a real disappointment and there are also no other facilities like gym, swimming pool etc. Staff was helpful and room service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great People”
Reviews.Author: ScottWI
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the staff. It's been a year now and I've been meaning to write this review for a while... I stayed at Fiesta in Cuautitlan in March of 2007. I was there, away from family, for over 30 days. Not once did I feel out of place, my room was always tidy, and the Hotel Staff was always sensitive to my needs. Cesar, the bartender (although I've heard he's moved on) was always there for honest explanations of culture and local things to do. There wasn't a lot of free time while I visited, but there was enough to take his advice. He was also a mixology genius :) If in the area for business, especially a longer-term stay, I would highly recommend this hotel. It's located in a shopping district, complete with restaurants (fast food and fancy), as well as a Wal-Mart and several other conveniences that are secure and necessary for longer stays. A+. And if the staff ever reads this - thanks much for everything you do.

HotelInfo.Name: Fiesta Inn Cuautitlan
HotelInfo.Address: Av. Chalma s/n | Estado de Mexico, Mexico City 54700, Mexico
